about.title: The Journey of a Hybrid Innovator
about.intro: I'm Clifford Ondieki, a Technical Program Manager who believes true innovation springs from deeply understanding systems—whether they're power grids or human connections. My journey, from the vibrant communities of Kitale, Kenya, to the dynamic tech landscape of Berlin, has been a continuous path of engineering solutions and embodying purpose.

spark.title: The Spark
spark.content: In Kitale, fixing a broken radio as a child ignited my passion for understanding how things work. Later, at university, a project failure taught me that setbacks are simply redirections toward better solutions.

evolution.title: Overcoming & Evolving
evolution.content: Balancing university, work, and leadership while adapting to life in Germany taught me invaluable lessons in time management, adaptability, and the art of breaking down complex problems into manageable solutions.

guiding.title: My Guiding Stars
guiding.content: My grandfather's wisdom—'Understanding is more important than memorization'—shaped my approach to problem-solving. This principle guides every technical challenge and leadership decision I make.

heritage.title: Cultural Impact
heritage.content: My Kenyan roots instilled in me a profound appreciation for community and collaboration—principles I bring to every team and project. It's about collective problem-solving, open dialogue, and understanding the human element behind every technological solution.

vision.title: Future Vision
vision.content: Looking ahead, I'm driven to lead projects that merge engineering with AI-driven solutions in automation and efficiency. Ultimately, I aim to mentor the next generation of engineers, fostering STEM education in Africa, and continue to break barriers while staying true to my passion for purpose-driven problem-solving.

projects.title: Engineering Stories
projects.subtitle: Each project tells a story of challenge, innovation, and human impact

kinangop.title: Kinangop Wind Integration
kinangop.description: Grid stability optimization for renewable energy integration
kinangop.story: This project wasn't just about grid stability; it taught me how data-driven decisions can inform human-centric solutions, a lesson I later applied to health tech load-balancing.

predictive.title: Predictive Maintenance AI
predictive.description: Machine learning solution for geothermal plant optimization
predictive.story: Developing this for geothermal plants honed my systemic thinking. It revealed that optimization principles apply universally, now informing my approach to SaaS operations.

health.title: Health Tech Load Balancer
health.description: Ensuring reliable access to critical health services
health.story: This project embodied my belief that resilience isn't just for power lines—it's for people's access to vital services. Every optimization had a human story behind it.

philosophy.title: Engineering Empathy
philosophy.subtitle: My philosophy stems from a belief that the most robust systems are built with deep understanding and shared purpose
insights: Debugging transformers taught me systemic thinking; raising a daughter taught me patience and the profound simplicity of presence.
Agile isn't just for software—it's for power grids too. It's about adapting, learning, and finding clarity over chaos.
Stillness is my power. In a world of constant motion, true clarity emerges when I release the need for self-negotiation.
My Kenyan heritage emphasizes community and collaboration—principles that deeply inform my approach to building empathetic teams.
